Key Arguments: The legislation will damage free speech, which is a fundamental human right.
The definition of 'misinformation' in the bill is too subjective, particularly regarding what constitutes 'harm'.
Governments cannot effectively police subjective interpretations of harm.
The bill represents an extreme encroachment on free speech rights.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is a non-negotiable human right and must be safeguarded for today and tomorrow.
It is simply not possible for governments to police such subjectivity. It is communistic!
